title: The General List
description: Blocks ads & annoyances, analytics & trackers, crypto-jacking & resource abusers, malware, and phishing

sources.title: Dan Pollock’s hosts file
sources.description: Protects you from many types of spyware, reduces bandwidth use, blocks certain pop-up traps, prevents user tracking by way of \"web bugs\" embedded in spam, provides partial protection to IE from certain web-based exploits and blocks most advertising you would otherwise be subjected to on the internet

sources.title: Energized Basic Protection - Whitelist
sources.description: Basic list of whitelisted domains

sources.title: MMotti AdguardHome - regex.txt
sources.description: Regular expressions generated from various sources for advanced filtering for use with AdGuard Home.

sources.title: Peter Lowe's Blocklist
sources.description: Blocklist for use with Adblock Plus

sources.title: Matomo.org - referrer spammers
sources.description: This is a community-contributed list of referrer spammers maintained by Matomo, the leading open source web analytics platform.

sources.title: Personal Blocklist by WaLLy3K
sources.description: Content added to this list has been manually verified, and is updated irregularly

sources.title: FadeMind's add.Dead
sources.description: Dead sites based on http://www.hostsfile.org/hosts.html content.

sources.title: FadeMind's add.Risk
sources.description: Risk content sites based on http://www.hostsfile.org/hosts.html content.

sources.title: FadeMind's add.Spam
sources.description: Spam sites based on http://www.hostsfile.org/hosts.html content.

sources.title: FadeMind's UncheckyAds
sources.description: Windows installers ads sources

sources.title: ABP Adblock Warning Removal List
sources.description: The Adblock Warning Removal List specifically removes obtrusive messages and warnings targeted to users who use an adblocker.

sources.title: ABP filters
sources.description: Removes circumvention ads in Adblock Plus

sources.title: AdAway
sources.description: AdAway is an open source ad blocker for Android using the hosts file

sources.title: AdGuard Annoyances filter
sources.description: Blocks irritating elements on webpages, including cookie notices, third-party widgets and in-page popups (Doesn’t include social media widgets and buttons, to block them you can still use Social media filter separately). It was inspired by Fanboy Annoyances List, but doesn’t duplicate it, so you can use them both together

sources.title: AdGuard Base filter
sources.description: Filter that enables removing of the ads from websites with English content. Originally based on the EasyList filter. Modified by us according to the complaints from users. This filter is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported license.

sources.title: AdGuard Mobile ads filter
sources.description: Filter that blocks ads on mobile devices. Contains all known mobile ad networks.

sources.title: AdGuard Safari filter
sources.description: Special filter for Safari 9 and above on iOS and MacOS to use in combination with AdGuard (or other) filter lists. We need a seperate filter because Safari's Content Blocking API does not fully support AdGuard's advanced rules syntax.

sources.title: EasyList Cookie List
sources.description: EasyList Cookie List blocks cookies banners, GDPR overlay windows and other privacy-related notices

sources.title: EasyList EasyPrivacy
sources.description: EasyPrivacy is an optional supplementary filter list that completely removes all forms of tracking from the internet, including web bugs, tracking scripts and information collectors, thereby protecting your personal data.

sources.title: Quidsup's NoTrack Malware Blocklist
sources.description: Malware Domains Block List from quidsup.net

sources.title: Quidsup's NoTrack Tracker Blocklist
sources.description: Tracker Domains Block List from quidsup.net

sources.title: crazy-max's WindowsSpyBlocker (Spy)
sources.description: Block spying and tracking on Windows systems

sources.title: ZeroDot1's CoinBlocker Domains List
sources.description: A list for administrators to prevent mining in networks

sources.title: ZeroDot1's CoinBlocker Domains List Optional
sources.description: An additional list for administrators

sources.title: Spam404
sources.description: blocks scam sites

sources.title: StopForumSpam
sources.description: Forum spammers

sources.title: Geoffrey Frogeye's block list of first-party only trackers
EU US most prevalent ads & trackers
sources.description: This blocklist is based on surveys of most used advertising and tracking technology (e.g. surveys of W3C, W3Tech and the on-line marketing community itself). These tech surveys are held once a year.

sources.title: abuse.ch URLhaus Host file
sources.description: URLhaus host file does only include domain names associated with malware URLs that are either active (malware sites that currently serve a payload) or that have been added to URLhaus in the past 48 hours

sources.title: Fanboy's Anti-Cookie Filters
sources.description: This will remove cookie and privacy warnings (List already included in Annoyances List, don't add list if you're using the Annoyances List)

sources.title: Fanboy's Enhanced Trackers List
sources.description: Blocks common tracking scripts such as Omniture, Webtrends, Foresee, Coremetrics, Google-Analytics, Touchclarity, ChannelIntelligence.

sources.title: Fanboy's Notifications Blocking List
sources.description: Specialization: removes website notification popups (included in Fanboy's Annoyances)

sources.title: Hexxium Creation's Threat List
sources.description: Blocks scams/phishing/malware/malvertising/exploits - and other general threats

sources.title: hoshsadiq's NoCoin Filter List
sources.description: Blocking Web Browser Bitcoin Mining

sources.title: Mailborder Phishing Bad Sites
sources.description: The phishing bad sites is updated using data from www.phishtank.com once per day. The domains included are known to be fraudulent and generally dangerous.

sources.title: MetaMask's ETH Phishing Detect
sources.description: Utility for detecting phishing domains targeting Ethereum users.

sources.title: anudeepND's Commonly Whitelisted Domains
sources.description: Commonly whitelisted domains for Pi-Hole

sources.title: anudeepND's Commonly Whitelisted Domains (Optional)
sources.description: This file contain domains that are needed to be whitelisted depending on the service you use. (It may include analytics sites!)

sources.title: AdGuard Tracking Protection filter
sources.description: The most comprehensive list of various online counters and web analytics tools. If you do not want your actions on the Internet be tracked, use this filter.

sources.title: Steven Black's ad-hoc list
sources.description: This is the ad-hoc list from StevenBlack/hosts

sources.description: internal list
